title: Steppe Cement's interim loss narrows but revenue plunges on strong dollar
text:

Fri, Sep 11, 2015, 12:00 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 30 mins Steppe Cement's interim loss narrows but revenue plunges on strong dollar By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast â€“ 7 minutes ago 16.30 -1.20 
  Construction materials producer Steppe Cement (LSE: STCM.L - news ) posted a narrower pre-tax loss in the first half of the year, although revenue fell sharply because of strong currency headwinds. In the six months to 30 June, the Kazakhstan-focused group posted a $2.3m pre-tax loss compared to a $6.4m loss in the first half of 2014, while revenue declined 13.7% year-on-year to $44.7m. 
Due to the devaluation of the tenge, the Kazakh currency, against the dollar, revenue declined 14% year-on-year in dollar terms and fell 9% year-on-year in tenge terms, as average prices dropped 10% in the period. 
Sales volumes rose 1.1% to 717.654 tonnes of cement, while gross margin improved by 1% as operating costs declined 12% and selling expenses per tonne fell 13% from the corresponding period in 2014. 
Steppe shares were down 6.86% to 16.30p at 1043 BST on Friday.
